content: Investments PFF Panel 4 Seedly PFF 2019 Asked by AnonymousAsked on 02 Mar 2019To dawn sgbudgetbabe: what do you recommend for passive income with low risk for a beginner investor? 2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Dawn FionaLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 03 Mar 2019A market index like S&P500 or STI ETF could be a good place to look at and consider if it fits your investment objectives. These comprise of a basket of (mostly) blue-chip stocks which track the market returns and usually offer dividends. So that gives you lower risk than if you had invested in smaller or less known companies, and the passive income still comes to you in the form of dividend yield.0 comments0

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Mar 2019Im not Dawn but you can consider SSBs and also some good high interest savings accounts. CPF is also another option but they are passive income only when you reach 65 years old.0 comments0
